title: How to Turn on Dark Mode on Your Kindle: An Easy Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Power on your Kindle.
steps.content: Power on your Kindle. If you set up a passcode, enter it in. [1] X Research source You can easily change your Kindle password if you forgot it. Make sure to charge your Kindle .

steps.title: Swipe down on your screen.
steps.content: Swipe down on your screen. This will open your quick settings.

steps.title: Click "Dark Mode".
steps.content: Click "Dark Mode". This will have an icon of a half-black and half-white circle. Your Kindle will shift to Dark Mode . [2] X Research source To turn Dark Mode off, click it again. If you don't see the Dark Mode option, your device may not be updated to its latest version. Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi. The software should download automatically. You can also manually update by downloading the Kindle Software to your computer and transferring it to your Kindle drive. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Power on your Kindle.
steps.content: Power on your Kindle. If you set up a passcode, enter it in.

steps.title: Tap ⋮ in the top right corner.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ in the top right corner. You should be on your home screen by default. If you have a book open, double-tap the top of the page to open your options.

steps.title: Click Invert Black and White to toggle it "On".
steps.content: Click Invert Black and White to toggle it "On". This will invert all text, images, and page colors on all screens. [6] X Research source To turn Invert off, toggle the switch to Off . If it doesn't apply, turn off your Kindle and turn it back on again.
